p: Challenge of mice with H3N2‐1968 virus at 6 months after vaccination induced a significant weight loss in unvaccinated mice, whilst all vaccinated mice were still protected with no lethality and no differences between weight loss between S‐IIV and eIIV (Figure 6a). Therefore, our definition of protection is based on lung viral loads and damage to the lung by total protein concentration. Importantly, A‐eIIV and H‐eIIV exhibited earlier viral clearance in the lungs by day 7 than S‐IIV (Figure 6b). Meanwhile, S‐IIV‐mediated protection had waned and viral loads were comparable to unvaccinated PBS mice (Figure 6b); however, there was a trend for less damage to the lung (by total protein concentration) for S‐IIV mice compared with the PBS groups ( P = 0.009; Figure 6c).
